alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 2:40PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE CAMERON PEAK BURN AREA IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Cameron Peak burn area. A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 240 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glen Haven and Masonville. - This includes the following additional locations... Moondance Way, Stringtown Gulch, Big Bear, Crystal Mountain, The Retreat and Storm Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
